text:
The FancyIndexing generates HTML-code which does not validate as HTML 4.01 Transitional. For the following example the IndexOptions are: 'FancyIndexing IconHeight=20 IconWidth=20 NameWidth=25 DescriptionWidth=* FoldersFirst SuppressColumnSorting SuppressLastModified SuppressHTMLPreamble' Part of the Apache-generated-code: '
 
Name                      Size  Description'

Error: element "IMG" not allowed here; check which elements this element may be 
contained within 

'
'
Error: element "HR" not allowed here; possible cause is an inline element 
containing a block-level element 

' Parent Directory              - '
Error: element "IMG" not allowed here; check which elements this element may be 
contained within 
...

The element "IMG" may not be contained in "pre". 

Besides: It would be better to generate lowercase characters (img not IMG) to 
be valid with XHTML.
creator: Schneider@mail.FB15.Uni-Dortmund.DE
slive@apache.org
text:
The inside 
 thing will not be fixed.  It has been like that
forever, and there is really no way around it.

If you want something a little more standards-compliant, I suggest you try
IndexOptions HTMLTable

text:
With IndexOptions HTMLTable, the HTML header is still HTML 3.2 and it uses the
"th" element with a "title" attribute:

  <th title="Icon">

which is not valid HTML 3.2

creator: nd@perlig.de
text: This can be closed. The title attribute doesn't appear in the current source tree.
